This is a very old build of mine that is inspired from the Legendary Kung-Fu Masters of old. The one inch punch or the DIM-MAK strike that could froze the heart of the recipient and so on.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hey, I like the way you build monks that are good at doing monk things

Stunning fist DC 42 looks sharp.
QP DC 36 is not shabby.
AB +38 is perhaps a bit on the low side, but that of course depends on what you are up against where you play.
7 attacks/round with FoB means 3 attacks in flurry 1, incrasing the chance to actually hit and force a roll with your special attacks.

I have some comments on your skill selection.
UMD 31 (30) ends on a fine rounded number dividable by 5, perfect for magical gear. If you want to make sure that you can cast from scrolls with guaranteed 100% success, you will need UMD 34 (33). That will ensure a minimum roll of 1+33=34 just enough for level 9 spells DC: 25+9=34. You only need 3 ranks more.
I also wonder why you take Disable traps 15 (15). Dt is a take 20 skill. The DCs for deadly traps are 22, 26, 31 and 36, requiring a modified skill of 2, 6, 11 or 16. It only costs you one more skill point to be able to handle the most difficult ones.
There seems to be a mismatch between nearly being able to disable all deadly traps and having no ranks in seach and an intelligence of 10. The search DCs for deadly traps are 10, 14, 18 and 22. Search is not a take 20 skill. You get a smal racial bonus to search from elf, but even so most of the time you will need many rounds before you are able to detect the more difficult deadly traps with DC 18 and 22.

Aye it shows that is an old build heh, numbers are wrong by a couple of points for traps e.t.c

Based on your suggestions Mick, it seems that with my limited skill points (if i want to keep stealth high) is to forget about disarming traps and get thos epoints to UMD to end it in a rounded 35 and more stealth. Leftovers can go to open locks.

So first things first let's do the skills.

Move Silently: 43 (53)
Hide: 43 (53)
UMD: 36 (35)
Tumble: 40 (49)
Open Locks: 14 (22)

So better stealth, UMD & Open locks at the cost of an immature Disable traps. Looks better in my eyes too now.


Secondary thing is the AB, i can see that i can harvest 1 more point by going DEX 28/ WIS 20 and dropping the Stunning Fist DC by one point. I think it is worth it for 1 more AB right?

Perhaps is there a way to get AS too and reach a 40 AC with just a t-shirt, perhaps not.

Maye i should look into a Monk 30/ FTR 4/ CoT 6 combo for getting better numbers?

AB 40, AC 40 & SR 40 would be very nice if i were not to drop below (also) 40 the DC of the stunning fist. What do you say?


Thanks for the suggestions!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, I wasn't going to say anything, but you made the noob mistake of taking Epic Prowess before Epic Weapon Focus. Swap them around!

I understand what you're going for in this build, but I have to say I would make him a STR build. As it sits, there is no reason for you to go DEX except MAYBE a higher AC, but if you are forfeiting Epic Dodge by not taking Rogue to at least 10, maybe you should reconsider the whole thing. Basically, what I mean is:

If you go for 30 / 6 / 4, I think it'd be better as a Strength build. You run FAST AS HELL, so AC isn't that much of a concern (I know, except for WoG bosses ), go for broke and make him damage things A LOT.

I think for a DEX build, you may want to aim at getting Epic Dodge with something like Monk 20 Fighter 10 Rogue 10. That build would get 3 Fighter bonus feats in epics, which could be AS, EWF and EWS, then you could take Epic Dodge on a general feat and time your Monk levels to take some Monk feats as general feats, but you'd be missing a couple of Monk bonus feats (to make up for that you'd have more general feats for free).

Anyway, that's just my opinion.

Take it EZ!

Anyway thanks for the input man! He gets slightly better little by little.
